snippet: A study of a large family with Alzheimer’s found that its precursors begin even earlier than previously thought, and that the brain may deteriorate in more ways than has been documented before.
abstract: Dr Eric Reiman and Dr Francisco Lopera studies published in journal Lancet Neurology find that brains of people destined to develop Alzheimer’s disease clearly show changes at least 20 years before they have any cognitive impairment.
lead_paragraph: A study of a large family with Alzheimer’s found that its precursors begin even earlier than previously thought, and that the brain may deteriorate in more ways than has been documented before.

headline.seo: Alzheimer’s Precursors Founds at Earlier Age
headline.main: Alzheimer’s Precursors Evident in Brain at Early Age
headline.print_headline: Alzheimer’s Precursors Evident in Brain at Early Age
